intro: Polychilos wilsonii, commonly known as the Wilson's polychilos, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of other umbelliferous plants. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It is native to specific regions in South Africa, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
